commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, (no ball)six over long-on! We've seen this sight before: Rinku finishing a T20 off with a six. But, and for whatever that's worth, it was a no-ball, so the six won't count; only the run off the no-ball will. Abbott bowled right in the slot around middle stump, inviting Rinku to loft down the ground. He went ahead, and ended up depositing the ball way beyond the boundarySee all photos
second_commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, no ball, Rinku Singh does the job! Don't need to bother running when you can hit them that far, in fact it doesn't matter because Abbott oversteps! So the six won't be added to the scorebooks but an India win will certainly be. Was a half-volley on middle that Rinku Singh launched into the stands at long-on

commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, 1 run, OUTanother run-out chance! And by Abbott and Arshdeep's reactions, the latter could be short. But the third umpire will confirm. Wow, he is well short! India lose three wickets in three balls. It was a short delivery around middle and leg, as Rinku had a swing with a pull shot. The ball went wide of long-on, whose throw to Abbott was a little wide of the stumps. But Abbott took it and banged the stumps to find Arshdeep shortArshdeep Singh run out (Smith/Abbott) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0
second_commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, out Arshdeep Singh Run Out!! 1 run completed. And another run-out! Three wickets in three balls! Was a slower length delivery on off-stump, Rinku Singh hung back and heaved it away towards deep mid-wicket, he wanted two but Arshdeep Singh was found just short of his ground at the bowler's end. The throw was good and flat and the bowler did the rest. Arshdeep Singh run out (Smith/Abbott) 0(0)

commentary: Abbott to Ravi Bishnoi, OUTBishnoi is run-out at the bowler's end! But importantly for India, Rinku will be on strike next ball. Abbott bowled it short outside off, getting it to climb sharply. Bishnoi looked to pull but missed, and the batters ran almost blindly. Wade had a go at the stumps at his end but missed; but Abbott collected the throw, and hit the stumps at the other end to find Bishnoi shortRavi Bishnoi run out (†Wade/Abbott) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0See all photos
second_commentary: Abbott to Ravi Bishnoi, out Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! Bishnoi is run-out but importantly for India, Rinku gets himself back on strike. Was banged in short at pace, Ravi Bishnoi looked to hook and missed. Rinku was running through for the bye just as the bowler delivered, Wade missed at the striker's end but the bowler gathered and ran Bishnoi out at the other. Would've spelled a lot of trouble for India had Wade hit the stumps at the striker's end. Ravi Bishnoi run out (Wade/Abbott) 0(1)

commentary: Abbott to Axar Patel, OUTAbbott takes a good catch to keep India waiting! He ended quite a few steps behind from where he delivered the ball, with the ball dropping over his shoulder. Axar looked to pull this shortish ball around middle and off, but got a top edge. The ball popped up, and with the mid-on fielder almost rushing in, Abbott did wellAxar Patel c & b Abbott 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 33.33
second_commentary: Abbott to Axar, out Caught&Bowled!! Axar swings himself off his feet and he's out! Slower length delivery on middle, Axar threw everything at this and didn't connect at all, he went for the glory shot but got a top-edge, it lobbed up and the bowler ran a couple of paces back before taking a simple catch over his shoulder. Now a new man will be on strike. Axar c and b Abbott 2(6)

commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, 1 byebeaten by the ball, but they get a bye as Wade fumbles. Short of a length outside off, as Rinku looked to swat but missed. The ball trickled to short third's right off Wade's bodySee all photos
second_commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, byes, 1 run, slower length delivery just outside off, Rinku Singh waited for it looking to cut and missed, Wade got an odd bounce and fumbled allowing a bye

commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsflashed over point! Short and angling across to end pretty wide of off, as Rinku went chasing it far away from his body. The ball did go off the top half of the bat, but was wide enough of the point fielder leaping to his left
second_commentary: Abbott to Rinku Singh, FOUR, that makes it a lot easier! Length delivery wide outside off, Rinku Singh shuffled across and reached out, just managed to slice it away past backward point off the outer half, celebrations in the stands already

commentary: Ellis to Rinku Singh,  1 runrides the bounce of this short ball on middle, and pulls to deep backward square
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, banged in short on middle, Rinku Singh got on top the bounce and pulled it down to deep square leg

commentary: Ellis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runspumped down the ground! Just to the left of the man at mid-off. On the fuller side of a length, and angling across to finish around sixth stump. Rinku rammed that back between mid-off and Axar
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, superb shot, especially under pressure. Wasn't a great delivery though, was a half-volley at pace on off-stump, Rinku Singh drilled it to the left of mid-off with a clean hit

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel,  1 runguides this short delivery around off stump just wide of short third, letting the ball come on to him
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, 1 run, slower short ball on off-stump, Axar waits for it and just eases it towards short third man for a quick single

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, no runshort of a length just around off, and punched to extra cover. Another dot ball
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, no run, length delivery on off-stump, Axar punches it straight to the fielder at extra cover, just a bit of pressure on Axar now

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, no runnow it's a short ball. Bangs it outside off and bowls much quicker, as Axar looks to pull but is beaten
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, no run, banged in short just outside off, that was pace on and it rushed Axar as he just about swayed out of the way

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, no runlooked to drive at this length ball angling across to finish around sixth stump, but the ball dribbled back to the keeper off the inside edge
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, no run, full and wide outside off, Axar looked to smack it down the ground and got a thick inside edge that went to the keeper on the bounce

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, no runlooked to drive at this length ball angling across to finish around sixth stump, but the ball dribbled back to the keeper off the inside edge
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, wide, slower delivery full and wide outside off, well past the line

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, 1 widebowls a slower ball, but it's a wide. On a length and wide of off, as Axar left that alone
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, no run, full and wide outside off, Axar looked to smack it down the ground and got a thick inside edge that went to the keeper on the bounce

commentary: Ellis to Axar Patel, 1 widebowls a slower ball, but it's a wide. On a length and wide of off, as Axar left that alone
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Axar, wide, slower delivery full and wide outside off, well past the line

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, no runstabs this shortish ball outside off to point for a rare dot ball
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, no run, short of length on off-stump, Rinku Singh hangs back and steers it towards backward point

commentary: Behrendorff to Axar Patel,  1 runshort of a length on middle, and clipped to fine leg
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Axar, 1 run, short of length on leg-stump, tucked off his hips towards deep backward square leg

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar, OUTgreat catch by Hardie! He seemed to be placed at mid-on, as he turned around and sprinted towards long-on. The ball was dropping over his shoulder, as he dived forward to nab that. It was a knuckle ball which trapped Surya, as Behrendorff bowled on a length, angling it across off. Surya was deep in the crease, and also across, lofting it with little timingSuryakumar Yadav c Hardie b Behrendorff 80 (42b 9x4 4x6 76m) SR: 190.47
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Hardie at long-on!! In the air and Hardie takes a superb catch! Slower delivery pitched up fuller outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reached out looking to smoke this down the ground but it came off the toe end, Hardie sprinted back from mid-on and kept his eyes on it all the way, had to leap forward in the end to take it and he held on. Superb technique and conviction in that catch. An excellent knock from the skipper nonetheless. Suryakumar Yadav c Hardie b Behrendorff 80(42) [4s-9 6s-4]

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar, no runnow he looks to loft with his bottom hand, but is beaten by this good-length ball around off stump
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower length delivery on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav looked to smash this away over extra cover and missed

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar, FOUR runsdrags this to deep backward point! This ball was angled across, and bowled on a yorker length wide of off. Surya reached out and drove that all along the ground
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, outstanding! He's just toying with Australia now! Full and slanting across wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav just stood his ground, reached out and carved it away to the deep point fence

commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh,  1 runshort of a length just outside off, and pushed to point for a quick single
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Rinku Singh, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump, Rinku Singh hung back and eased it towards backward point for a quick single

commentary: Ellis to Rinku Singh,  1 runpushes this to deep third, with the ball being shortish and outside off
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump, Rinku Singh pats it down to third man

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar,  1 runa tennis-batted pull to deep midwicket. Short ball on middle and off, and a hard pull this time
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower delivery banged in short on middle, swatted away to deep mid-wicket

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, FOUR runsramped over short third! Short delivery outside off from Ellis, and Surya rode the bounce of this one around off stump to send that flaying for four more
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this is trademark SKY! Slower short ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav waited for it and sliced it over short third man wristily

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar,  SIX runsthis is effortless! Not even the full flow of the bat, and the ball travels for six over long-on. Length ball around middle stump, and Surya just went with the line to loft that comfortably
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, right out of the middle! Full and straight on off-stump, right in the slot, Suryakumar Yadav went deep in his crease and smoked it over wide long-on

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runon a hard length just outside off, and Surya ends up chopping back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length delivery on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav looked to heave it away and it went into the off-side off the toe end

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runon a hard length just outside off, and Surya ends up chopping back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, slower delivery ends up down leg again, pressure showing

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runon a hard length just outside off, and Surya ends up chopping back to the bowler
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, slower length delivery ends up going down leg

second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length delivery on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav looked to heave it away and it went into the off-side off the toe end

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, 1 wideanother wide. This is just outside leg though, and Ellis isn't pleased. This ball was full, with Surya first looking to swipe but then letting it go

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, 1 wideanother wide. This is just outside leg though, and Ellis isn't pleased. This ball was full, with Surya first looking to swipe but then letting it go

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, 1 wideshaped to scoop this length ball outside leg, which angled down further. He missed, and it's called wide
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length delivery on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav looked to heave it away and it went into the off-side off the toe end

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, 1 wideshaped to scoop this length ball outside leg, which angled down further. He missed, and it's called wide

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, 1 wideshaped to scoop this length ball outside leg, which angled down further. He missed, and it's called wide
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, slower length delivery ends up going down leg

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, FOUR runsmid-on is inside the circle, and Surya lofts over and wide of him. Shorter side of a length - and at pace off - as Ellis gave Surya room to have a swing. Surya obliged, and bagged four
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, stand and deliver! Juicy half-volley just outside off, Suryakumar Yadav stood his ground and smacked it over mid-on who was inside the ring

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsa pick-up sweep to fine leg! Hung deep in the crease - and also slightly across - as he swiped through the line at this good-length ball around leg stump
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, poor delivery, goes full and on the pads, easy pickings for Rinku Singh who swivels and flicks it away to the deep backward square leg fence

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runsa pick-up sweep to fine leg! Hung deep in the crease - and also slightly across - as he swiped through the line at this good-length ball around leg stump
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, wide, banged in short on middle, Rinku Singh ducked and it was called a wide

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, 1 widetries the bouncer, but it's given wide. Bangs it short on middle and leg, with the ball looping up rather high after Rinku ducked
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, poor delivery, goes full and on the pads, easy pickings for Rinku Singh who swivels and flicks it away to the deep backward square leg fence

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, 1 widetries the bouncer, but it's given wide. Bangs it short on middle and leg, with the ball looping up rather high after Rinku ducked
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, wide, banged in short on middle, Rinku Singh ducked and it was called a wide

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, no runwent for the pull at this short ball on leg, but missed out, getting hit high on the body
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length delivery on middle, Rinku Singh looked to swivel-pull and was through the shot too early, got struck on the body

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar,  1 runanother short ball around off, but this is hacked to deep point
second_commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower length delivery on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav backed away and punched it away to deep point

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar, FOUR runsstabs to deep backward point! Short of a length on sixth stump - there was good bounce there too - as Surya waited before poking it past point for four more
second_commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, superb shot! Slower length delivery outside off, Suryakumar Yadav backed away to make room and slapped it away behind point with finesse

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh,  1 runchips this to mid-off, with the ball being on a length on off. He knows he has missed out on a probable boundary there
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, 1 run, full and straight on off-stump, they run with the shot to mid-off

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runswow, superbly guided between short third and point! Waits for this good-length ball to arrive on sixth stump, and opens the face of the bat very late to help it along
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, expertly guided! Length delivery slanting across just outside off, Rinku Singh hung back and just opened the face of the blade to steer it right into the gap between short third man and backward point

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR runswow, superbly guided between short third and point! Waits for this good-length ball to arrive on sixth stump, and opens the face of the bat very late to help it along
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, wide, slower length delivery wide outside off, Rinku Singh looks to reach out and misses

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, 1 wideshort and wide of off, climbing high too. Rinku went slashing away from his body but missed, and it's given wide
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, FOUR, expertly guided! Length delivery slanting across just outside off, Rinku Singh hung back and just opened the face of the blade to steer it right into the gap between short third man and backward point

commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, 1 wideshort and wide of off, climbing high too. Rinku went slashing away from his body but missed, and it's given wide
second_commentary: Stoinis to Rinku Singh, wide, slower length delivery wide outside off, Rinku Singh looks to reach out and misses

commentary: T Sangha to Rinku Singh,  1 runvery full on the stumps, and driven down to long-off
second_commentary: Sangha to Rinku Singh, 1 run, tossed up full on middle, driven down the ground to long-off

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma, OUTwell taken by Stoinis at extra cover! He had to keep his eyes on the ball for a long time, even as it was swirling in the air. Eventually, he dived to his left to gobble that. Sangha bowled that fullish and outside off, with Tilak having another free swing at it. But he ended up skying it very high, and falling while attempting another boundaryTilak Varma c Stoinis b Sangha 12 (10b 2x4 0x6 10m) SR: 120See all photos
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, out Caught by Stoinis!! Sangha has a second! He tosses one up full and wide, again out of the left hander's reach, Tilak Varma went for a big shot anyway and ended up getting a top-edge that went straight up in the air, Stoinis the fielder judged it beautifully and took it leaping sideways, held on even after landing hard. Tilak Varma c Stoinis b Sangha 12(10) [4s-2]

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runfullish ball on the stumps, and dragged to deep point
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, inside-out drive out to sweeper cover

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma,  1 runlow full toss dipping outside off, and drilled to long-on
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, 1 run, tossed up full on middle, driven down the ground to long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma, FOUR runsswitch hit over short third! Shifts his stance, and has a swing at this shortish ball outside off. The ball ballooned over the fielder inside the circle
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, FOUR, excellent batting! Flatter delivery on leg-stump, Tilak Varma was quick to switch up his stance and he scooped it over short third man

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma, FOUR runspulled to deep midwicket! Shortish outside off, as Tilak went deep in the crease to cream this pull, with the ball hinting to turn back in
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, FOUR, smashed! Flatter just outside off, Tilak Varma went deep in his crease and pulled it away powerfully into the gap at deep mid-wicket

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, no runlooks to paddle scoop this, but the length is too short, and the line too wide outside off. Beaten in the end
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower short ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav waited for it and looked to scoop it over fine-leg and missed

commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma,  1 rundropped by Wade! But it was a difficult chance. He leaped to his left with his glove hanging out, as the ball tickled it and went to deep third. The ball was shortish outside off, and Tilak just had a swing at it, with the edge going behind
second_commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma, 1 run, edged and safe! Just short of length on off-stump, angled back in and cramped him for room as he looked to cut, he got a thick outside edge and Wade flung himself to his left, just got a bit of glove to it, not a real chance

commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma, no runshort in length, and again coming into off. Pushed back to the bowler
second_commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma, no run, length delivery on off-stump, Tilak Varma looks to punch it through cover but it goes back to the bowler off the splice

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar,  1 runlooked to clip, but got a leading edge towards extra cover. It was a length ball from Abbott, as Surya closed the face of the bat early
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, length delivery on middle-leg, leading edge goes towards cover as he was looking to tuck it into the leg-side

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar,  SIX runssix over long-on! Surya also reaches fifty. He just went lofting through the line at this fullish delivery on middle and leg, extending his arms to send that very high for six
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, now that's fifty for Suryakumar Yadav! Was pitched up full on middle, right in the slot and Suryakumar Yadav lofted it over long-on handsomely, excellent follow-through with high elbows and he held the pose

commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma,  1 runon the shorter side of a length outside off, and angled in towards off. Stabbed towards point by Tilak
second_commentary: Abbott to Tilak Varma, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump from round the wicket, Tilak Varma hangs back and pats it towards cover for one

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma,  1 runshapes to switch hit this full ball around middle and leg, but the ball spoons up off his glove. It landed beyond the keeper though
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, 1 run, length delivery on leg-stump, Tilak Varma went for a switch-hit but it was too short for that, got a bit of glove and it lobbed over the keeper

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma, no rungoes to sweep this full ball on middle and leg, but misses, and is hit on his pad outside leg
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, no run, floated up full on middle, Tilak Varma leaned in to slog-sweep and got an inside edge on to pad

commentary: T Sangha to Tilak Varma, no runfull on off, and hinting to turn away. Dabbed to point
second_commentary: Sangha to Tilak Varma, no run, good length delivery on off-stump, Tilak Varma nudges it into the off-side watchfully

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, OUTtaken at deep extra cover! That seemed to have been timed pretty well, but went bang where the man was stationed. Sangha bowled full and wide of off, enticing Kishan to launch inside out over the off-side ring. That is exactly what Kishan ended up doing, but perhaps all too well. Short took it reverse-cupped above his headIshan Kishan c Short b Sangha 58 (39b 2x4 5x6 56m) SR: 148.71
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Matthew Short!! Straight to the man! Sangha has the last laugh! Floats out a googly outside off, Ishan Kishan was made to reach out a bit as he looked to loft it over extra cover, he hit it on the up but didn't quite get the timing, ended up holing out to the man there who took a simple catch. Australia finally break the partnership. Ishan Kishan c Matthew Short b Sangha 58(39) [4s-2 6s-5]

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  SIX runsnow six over deep midwicket! Short of a length around off, and Kishan went deep in the crease to crash that hard and flat, just over the fielder on the boundary
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more! Flatter delivery on middle, Ishan Kishan pressed back and heaved it away over deep mid-wicket, went flat and just cleared the fielder on the ropes, Sangha under lots of pressure now

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, FOUR runsslogged between long-on and deep square leg! That is also Kishan's fifty. The ball was tossed up and dipping on leg stump, as he thrashed that through the line
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, fifty for Ishan Kishan! Tossed up full on middle, Ishan Kishan clears his front-leg and helicopter-whips this right into the gap at cow corner, raises his bat to the applause and is congratulated by his captain

commentary: Ellis to Ishan,  1 runmisfield by the man at extra cover, as that was rammed hard off a length, and wide of off. Kishan again went to play far away from his body, and eventually got a run wide of long-off
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, full and wide outside off, drilled straight to extra cover, slight mis-field and it goes towards long-off

commentary: Ellis to Ishan, no runskipped down after making room, and Ellis noted that. He bowled on a yorker length, and wide of off, forcing Kishan to chase it away from his body and get beaten
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Ishan Kishan, no run, pushed full and wide outside off, Ishan Kishan looked to come down the track to slice it and missed

commentary: Ellis to Ishan,  SIX runssmashing six over deep midwicket! A full flow of the bat, as he hoicked this short-of-a-length ball outside off with full force. That went a long way back
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Ishan Kishan, SIX, brings up the 100-run stand in style! Half-volley on middle, Ishan Kishan stood his ground and launched this into the stands at deep mid-wicket, 93m six that

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar,  1 runshort of a length around middle, and he looks to pull forcefully. The ball trickles off the bottom of the bat to fine leg
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower length delivery on middle, Suryakumar Yadav mistimes a heave towards deep backward square leg

second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full and straight on middle, clipped away to long leg

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar,  1 runshort of a length just outside off, and stabbed to point using his bottom hand

commentary: Stoinis to Ishan,  1 runyorker length, and wide of off. Driven to deep point, but with the bat face opening
second_commentary: Stoinis to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, very full outside off, carved out to deep cover

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar,  1 runslower ball, and again jumping off a length to cramp him for room on leg. Surya barely manages to poke it away towards point
second_commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, short of length on middle, Suryakumar Yadav backs away and eases it towards backward point, was off the glove

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar, FOUR runstypically Surya-like fortune! He looked to paddle-scoop this short delivery rising on top of middle and off, but ended up getting a top edge wide of the man at short third
second_commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lucky! Was a length delivery on middle, Suryakumar Yadav shuffled across his stumps a touch looking to lift it over fine-leg, just got a top-edge that went past short third man instead

commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar, no runfences this away from his body to point, as the ball is short and wide of off
second_commentary: Stoinis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower length delivery wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches out and taps it straight to backward point

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, no runBack of a length on-pace ball well outside off, he thrashes it but straight to extra cover
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, no run, length delivery slanting across outside off, mistimed straight to extra cover again

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, no runSlower offcutter outside off, slapped to extra cover
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, no run, length delivery outside off, mistimed slap goes to extra cover, Abbott is keeping it out of Ishan Kishan's reach

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, no runSlower offcutter outside off, slapped to extra cover
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, full and very wide outside off, third wide of the over

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideFuller and again well outside off, another wide
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, no run, length delivery outside off, mistimed slap goes to extra cover, Abbott is keeping it out of Ishan Kishan's reach

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideFuller and again well outside off, another wide
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, full and very wide outside off, third wide of the over

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar,  1 runDoes not carry to Sangha who was sprinting in from deep third. Surya is riding his luck today. Slower bouncer outside off. He ramps it and despite a great effort from Sangha, the catch does not bear fruit.
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, nearly placed the man to perfection! Just short of length on off-stump, Suryakumar Yadav got under it to ramp it and the fielder at third man was very fine, was pace off so it just fell short as he ran in

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  1 runSlower back of a length ball outside off, he cuts towards deep cover
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, slower length delivery outside off, Ishan Kishan taps it towards cover for one

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  2 runsFuller length ball just outside off, he punches it hard down the ground. Long-on does well to his left to save two runs
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fired in full on off-stump, smacked hard down the ground past his partner, good work in the deep from Hardie, dived to his left from long-off and kept it down to two

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  2 runsFuller length ball just outside off, he punches it hard down the ground. Long-on does well to his left to save two runs
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, Wade isn't happy with that, length delivery pushed across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan went a long way across to chase it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  2 runsFuller length ball just outside off, he punches it hard down the ground. Long-on does well to his left to save two runs
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, short and angling across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan threw his hands at it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideSlower offcutter well outside off, Kishan gets well across but can't connect. Called a wide again. A bit harsh imo
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fired in full on off-stump, smacked hard down the ground past his partner, good work in the deep from Hardie, dived to his left from long-off and kept it down to two

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideSlower offcutter well outside off, Kishan gets well across but can't connect. Called a wide again. A bit harsh imo
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, Wade isn't happy with that, length delivery pushed across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan went a long way across to chase it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideSlower offcutter well outside off, Kishan gets well across but can't connect. Called a wide again. A bit harsh imo
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, short and angling across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan threw his hands at it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideBack of a length ball outside off, he tries to reach it but can't. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fired in full on off-stump, smacked hard down the ground past his partner, good work in the deep from Hardie, dived to his left from long-off and kept it down to two

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideBack of a length ball outside off, he tries to reach it but can't. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, Wade isn't happy with that, length delivery pushed across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan went a long way across to chase it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Ishan, 1 wideBack of a length ball outside off, he tries to reach it but can't. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, wide, short and angling across wide outside off, Ishan Kishan threw his hands at it and missed

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar,  1 runOn a length outside off, he pats it neatly but short third does well to his right
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump, steered gently towards short third man for one

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runFuller on the stumps, he whips to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full on middle, whipped away to cow corner, just one

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  1 runTossed up outside off, he drives to long off
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, full outside off, Ishan Kishan strides out and pushes it down the ground to long-off

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, no runShort and very wide again. He reaches for it and cuts it hard to point. Would have been a wide had he left it
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, no run, would have been another wide, flat and well outside off, Ishan Kishan reached across and cut it straight to point

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, no runShort and very wide again. He reaches for it and cuts it hard to point. Would have been a wide had he left it
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, wide, flatter and quicker, pushes it too wide outside off as Ishan Kishan lets it go

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, 1 wideFlatter and very wide outside off. He shoulders arms and that is called a wide.
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, no run, would have been another wide, flat and well outside off, Ishan Kishan reached across and cut it straight to point

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, 1 wideFlatter and very wide outside off. He shoulders arms and that is called a wide.
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, wide, flatter and quicker, pushes it too wide outside off as Ishan Kishan lets it go

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  SIX runsTwo in two! Floated on leg stump, rather just out. He clears his front leg and flogs it in the gap between deep midwicket and long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, SIX, two in a row! Floated up full on middle, looked like a googly and Ishan Kishan picked it, he cleared his front-leg and hoisted it into the gap at cow corner, just cleared the ropes

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  SIX runsBANG! Googly on the pads, he gets the sweep out again and thumps him over deep backward square leg for a huge six
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, SIX, goes big! Tossed up on middle, Ishan Kishan leans forward again and smokes it over the ropes at deep mid-wicket with a slog sweep

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan, FOUR runsSmashes the weeps to Abbott at deep midwicket, who fumbles and concedes a four. Think he was caught in two minds whether to come in for the catch or save the four. Does neither.
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, goes through because of the sheer power! Full on middle, Ishan Kishan leant forward and slog-swept it so hard towards deep mid-wicket, went hard and flat, burst through the fielder's hands after the bounce

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan,  1 runback of a length ball into the body of Kishan who pulls to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, short of length on off-stump, heaved away towards mid-wicket

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar,  1 runTop-edge and the ball falls juuuust short of the deep backward square leg fielder haring in. Knuckle ball bowled short outside off. He looks for a pull, is early on the shot and is lucky the ball did not go to hand.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, in the air and safe! Slower length delivery on middle, Suryakumar Yadav looked to pull and was through the shot too early, a top-edge was found but it landed safe around backward square leg, long leg ran a long way in but couldn't get there

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan,  1 runSlower low full toss, Kishan is a little early on the push. Plays it past the bowler for a run
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, low full toss on middle, driven just past the stumps at the other end

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar,  1 runFuller again outside off, driven to long off
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full on off-stump, driven down the ground to long-off

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar, FOUR runsEdged and the ball flies past the keeper. Was the fuller-length ball angling away from the batter. He looks to drive on the up, gets a thick outside edge that goes to the right of Wade, who was at full-stretch
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four! Pitched up a lot fuller outside off, Suryakumar Yadav threw his hands at this and got a thick outside edge, just went past a diving Wade, 50-run stand comes up too

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar,  2 runsOn a length outside off, he drives on the up and gets it to the right of deep cover for a brace
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, good length delivery just outside off, driven nicely towards deep extra cover

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runPushed quicker on leg stump, he gets it to long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, length delivery on middle, punched down the ground to long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  1 runRank long hop and Kishan almost hit it straight down deep backward square leg's throat. Was too short and down leg. Kishan pulls rather meekly and is lucky the catch does not go to hand
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, on the bounce to the fielder! A real drag down on leg-stump, Ishan Kishan went deep in his crease and heaved it away behind square on the leg-side, nearly hit it to the fieler in the deep

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runSlower and fuller well outside off, he fetches the sweep and slams it to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, flighted delivery full outside off, Suryakumar Yadav leans in and fetches it with a sweep to deep backward square leg

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  1 runSkiddy legbreak outside off, he stays back and hacks the pull but long on is quite wide to intercept
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, flatter and quicker just outside off, Ishan Kishan presses back and pulls it down to wide long-on

commentary: T Sangha to Suryakumar,  1 runFuller on leg stump, Surya has taken a leg guard as he flicks to wide long on
second_commentary: Sangha to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tossed up full on leg-stump, Suryakumar Yadav strides forward and works it towards mid-wicket

commentary: T Sangha to Ishan,  1 runSlower legbreak outside off, pushes to long on off the backfoot
second_commentary: Sangha to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Ishan Kishan presses back and heaves it down to long-on

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runA bit of leading edge but does not go to hand. Was on a length outside off, he gets it towards point
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, full on off, Suryakumar looks to drive and squirts it off the outside half to point

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, FOUR runsExcellent timing and placement from Surya who looks like a man on a mission. Length on the pads, he gets across and flicks it imperiously through midwicket
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, half-volley on middle, Suryakumar flicks it nicely and finds the gap through midwicket. He's capitalising on all the loose balls coming his way, which are plenty

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runBetter lines now from Ellis. Keeps it wicket to wicket and on a length. Surya pushes towards mid-on
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, full ball on off, driven to mid-on

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, FOUR runsOn a length but the line is well down leg. He clips it to the left of short fine leg.
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor delivery. Full ball straying down leg, Suryakumar helps it away fine with a leg-glance. It went in the air but well away from short fine leg

commentary: Ellis to Suryakumar, no runLength on off and middle, he is cramped for room and can only defend
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, good length on middle, Suryakumar hangs back and defends

commentary: Ellis to Ishan,  1 runFuller outside off, he pushes to mid-off for a quick run
second_commentary: Nathan Ellis to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, punched to mid-off

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, FOUR runsExcellent timing, 20 of the over! Full-length ball outside off, he presents the full face of the bat and drives back past the bowler, who fumbles and on that outfield there's no stopping the ball once it beats the in field
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, simply knocks it down the ground and it races away! Slower one floated up on off, Suryakumar doesn't do much more than tap it down the pitch, but the timing is sublime. Once Abbott lets it go, the fielders at mid-off and mid-on are mere spectators on a lightning fast outfield

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, FOUR runsExcellent timing, 20 of the over! Full-length ball outside off, he presents the full face of the bat and drives back past the bowler, who fumbles and on that outfield there's no stopping the ball once it beats the in field
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, slower length ball down leg, Suryakumar doesn't get anything on it

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, 1 wideNow loses his radar, with the the length ball sliding down leg, called a wide.
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, simply knocks it down the ground and it races away! Slower one floated up on off, Suryakumar doesn't do much more than tap it down the pitch, but the timing is sublime. Once Abbott lets it go, the fielders at mid-off and mid-on are mere spectators on a lightning fast outfield

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, 1 wideNow loses his radar, with the the length ball sliding down leg, called a wide.
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, slower length ball down leg, Suryakumar doesn't get anything on it

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar,  SIX runsSHOT! On a length on leg stump, Surya gets across and elegantly whips it up and over  the vacant deep midwicket area.
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, brilliant pick-up shot! Half-volley on the pads, Suryakumar launches it over midwicket, sails over the boundary

commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar, no runShout for lbw as Surya misses the flick to a good length ball on middle and leg. Not given. Two sounds probably.
second_commentary: Abbott to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, good length on middle, nips in sharply and strikes the pad as Suryakumar is beaten on the drive. He got a little inside edge there

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  1 runBack of a length ball on the stumps, he scythes it to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, short of length on middle, pulled to deep square leg

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  SIX runsMuch better connection and that goes all the way. Length on Kishan's pads, he gets across and flicks it effortlessly over the deep midwicket fence
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, SIX, full on the pads, and this time Kishan times it beautifully! He whips it in the air, clears midwicket, and clears the ropes too

commentary: Abbott to Ishan,  2 runsStarts off with a length ball on middle and leg. He whips it over midwicket, but does not time it well enough
second_commentary: Abbott to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, full ball on middle, Kishan whips it in the air, but doesn't quite time it that well. It falls safely in the midwicket region before being cut off. He got it close to the toe-end there

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar,  SIX runsThere comes the Surya special. Pacy length ball down leg. Surya gets across and helps it over the deep fine leg fence  for six of the best
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, trademark Suryakumar! Back of a length down leg, and he pulls it over the fine leg boundary

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan,  1 runOn a length on the pads of Kishan who gets across and turns it to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, clipped to deep backward square

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runAnother jaffa! Back of a length ball that leaves the batter at the last moment. Kishan does well to drop his hands
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, sharp bounce! Back of a length outside off, Kishan pokes at it but it climbs on him, going past the outside edge to the keeper

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar,  1 runLength on middle stump, he gets across and as a wild waft at it, gets it down to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, good length on off, Suryakumar looks to slog and drags it off the inside half to deep backward square

commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar, no runCorker of a ball to start off. Back of a length ball outside off, he feel for it and is beaten
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, back of a length just outside off, hint of shape back in, but not as much as Suryakumar expects. He plays inside the line and it whistles through to the keeper

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan,  1 runOn a length on the pads as he clips it to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, good length ball slanted in on leg, clipped to deep square leg

commentary: MW Short to Ishan,  1 runAgain, very quick outside off, he stays back and slaps it down to long off
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length outside off, slapped to long-off

commentary: MW Short to Ishan, no runQuicker on off stump, punched to mid-on
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Ishan Kishan, no run, back of a length outside off, punched to mid-on

commentary: MW Short to Suryakumar,  1 runLength on middle and leg, he turns it behind square
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fired into the pads, flicked behind square

commentary: MW Short to Suryakumar,  1 runLength on middle and leg, he turns it behind square
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, fired down the leg-side from round the wicket, left alone

commentary: MW Short to Suryakumar, 1 wideDarted down leg, called a wide
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fired into the pads, flicked behind square

commentary: MW Short to Suryakumar, 1 wideDarted down leg, called a wide
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, fired down the leg-side from round the wicket, left alone

commentary: MW Short to Jaiswal, OUTOne shot too many from Jaiswal and Short has his maiden T20I wicket. It was in the slot to be hit, but the batter does not get the elevation. Outside off, he looks to go up and over mid-off, ends up hitting it straight to him who takes it gleefullyYashasvi Jaiswal c Smith b Short 21 (8b 2x4 2x6 12m) SR: 262.5See all photos
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Jaiswal, out Caught by Smith!! Gone! Fired in full outside off, Jaiswal looks to loft over mid-off but doesn't quite get hold of it. Fails to get enough elevation and Smith takes a good overhead catch in the circle. Jaiswal stood there for a moment in disappointment before walking off. Jaiswal c Smith b Matthew Short 21(8) [4s-2 6s-2]

commentary: MW Short to Jaiswal,  SIX runsTop-edge but the ball goes over the fence. Was bowled slower outside off. He goes for a sweep, and even with  the top-edge the ball flies over the deep fine leg fence
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Jaiswal, SIX, again goes for the sweep, but this takes a thick top-edge! It goes high in the air and sails over the fine leg boundary. Wow!

commentary: MW Short to Jaiswal, FOUR runsFired outside off, he gets across, bends low and thumps it to the deep square leg fence
second_commentary: Matthew Short to Jaiswal, FOUR, floated up outside off, Jaiswal gets low and smashes the sweep over square leg. Taking the spinner on immediately

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runAnd again! Draws Kishan forward with a full-length outswinger outside off. The batter does not quite reach the pitch and is beaten
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, full outside off, swinging away late, and beats the outside edge again after luring Kishan to drive. Lovely over - maiden from Behrendorff!

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runPlay and a miss now! On a length with just enough movement outside off to beat Kishan's attempted drive
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, good length outside off, swinging away, Kishan goes chasing after it and is beaten on the edge

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runFuller-length ball with a hint of shape outside off once more. The ball pins off the middle of the blade but straight to extra cover
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, pitched up outside off, driven to cover

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runFuller-length ball outside off, he drives neatly but straight to cover
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, full outside off, another outswinger, Kishan punches to short cover

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runTries to go fuller with the ball shaping away outside off. He lets it go again.
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, full outside off, shaping away, left alone

commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan, no runA hint of shape outside off on that length ball, he shoulders arms
second_commentary: Behrendorff to Ishan Kishan, no run, good length outside off, shaping away, left alone

commentary: Stoinis to Ishan,  1 runLength outside off, he pats it to deep third
second_commentary: Stoinis to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length across off, steered to deep backward point

commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, 1 run, OUTSlower short of a length ball, pulled to deep backward square leg, and dear oh dear, Gaikwad has been sold down the river completely. It was an easy single, but Jaiswal thought the second was on. He races back only to stop after taking a couple of steps. By that time, Gaikwad was already at a point of no return. The throw comes in, Wade even fumbles but Gaikwad was so far down that the keeper had the time to recover and whips off the bails. He is gone for a diamond duck.Ruturaj Gaikwad run out (Ellis/†Wade) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0See all photos
second_commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, out Gaikwad Run Out!! 1 run completed. Oh dear, Ruturaj Gaikwad gets run out without facing a ball! Terrible mix-up between the two batters! Looks like Jaiswal was the one who called him for the second and then said "no" when he reached halfway down the pitch. Slower short ball, pulled wide of fine leg. They complete a single, and then Jaiswal gets interested to get back for the second before realising it was very risky. However, the damage had been done. Gaikwad was halfway down the pitch with no chance of getting back. Even a little fumble from Wade didn't give him enough time. Gaikwad run out (Nathan Ellis/Wade) 0(0)

commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, no runA dash down the track as Stoinis goes back of a length with the ball angling away from the batter. He swings at it but makes no connection
second_commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, Jaiswal advances, slashes hard but misses

commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal,  SIX runsBANG! Jaiswal is wasting no time whatsoever. Stoinis goes for the short ball into the body but Jaiswal is so quick to get into position and pull it over deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, SIX, the crowd goes berserk as Jaiswal pulls his third ball into the stands! Dug in short, Jaiswal takes it on and nails it over backward square

commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, no runPlay and a miss now. Was short and a touch wide, he goes hard at a cut but makes no connection
second_commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, no run, back of a length outside off, Jaiswal looks to cut but is beaten

commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, FOUR runsWhat a shot to get the innings going. No swing for Stoinis. Length ball outside off, he gets forward and drives on the up past mid-off
second_commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, FOUR, crashed away on the up! Brilliant start from Jaiswal who gets off the mark in style! Fuller than a length just outside off, Jaiswal goes after it and drives hard through extra cover
